modules.title: Module 1: Limits and Continuity
objectives: Explain intuitive and formal notions of limits.
Evaluate one-sided and two-sided limits.
Determine continuity and classify discontinuities.
Differentiate core functions

lessons.title: Module 1: Limits and Continuity - Conceptual Grounding
objectives: Explain intuitive and formal notions of limits.
Evaluate one-sided and two-sided limits.
practiceSpecs: Short-form concept checks mapped to learning objectives.
masteryCheckSpecs: 2 conceptual prompts requiring explanation of reasoning.

lessons.title: Module 1: Limits and Continuity - Problem Solving and Application
objectives: Evaluate one-sided and two-sided limits.
Determine continuity and classify discontinuities.
practiceSpecs: Guided problem set with increasing difficulty.
Reflection checkpoint connecting methods to outcomes.
masteryCheckSpecs: 1 applied scenario requiring method selection and justification.

projectSpecs: Create a concept map comparing algebraic and graphical limit evaluation techniques.

modules.title: Module 2: Derivatives and Differentiation Rules
objectives: Compute derivatives using limit definitions.
Apply product, quotient, and chain rules correctly.
Interpret derivatives as rates of change in applied contexts.
Differentiate core functions

lessons.title: Module 2: Derivatives and Differentiation Rules - Conceptual Grounding
objectives: Compute derivatives using limit definitions.
Apply product, quotient, and chain rules correctly.
practiceSpecs: Short-form concept checks mapped to learning objectives.
masteryCheckSpecs: 2 conceptual prompts requiring explanation of reasoning.

lessons.title: Module 2: Derivatives and Differentiation Rules - Problem Solving and Application
objectives: Apply product, quotient, and chain rules correctly.
Interpret derivatives as rates of change in applied contexts.
practiceSpecs: Guided problem set with increasing difficulty.
Reflection checkpoint connecting methods to outcomes.
masteryCheckSpecs: 1 applied scenario requiring method selection and justification.

projectSpecs: Analyze a real-world changing quantity and justify a derivative-based model.

modules.title: Module 3: Applications of Derivatives
objectives: Solve optimization problems with clear assumptions.
Use derivatives to analyze monotonicity and concavity.
Apply related rates in geometric and physical settings.
Differentiate core functions

practiceSpecs: Guided problem set with increasing difficulty.

modules.title: Module 4: Integrals and Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
objectives: Interpret definite integrals as accumulation.
Compute antiderivatives and definite integrals.
Use the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus to connect derivatives and integrals.
Differentiate core functions
